snippet: Mr. Blatter, the governing body’s departing president, is expected to continue to serve until his successor is named.
abstract: FIFA announces that it will hold replacement elections for embattled president Sepp Blatter in February 2016, and roll out series of measures intended to restore tarnished image following corruption scandal; changes, announced by Blatter himself, fail to quell concerns, in part because Blatter will continue in office for seven months.

byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky and Andrew Das contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Blatter, the governing body’s departing president, is expected to continue to serve until his successor is named.

headline.main: FIFA Sets Vote to Replace Sepp Blatter and Begins Overhaul Campaign
headline.print_headline: FIFA Sets Election and an Overhaul Vote for February
